column4: is there a default setting somehwere for screen orientation? for some reason when I load ubuntu, my screen is upside down until I go to settings and make it "normal" orientation instead of 180 degrees.... no idea why it's stuck on 180 every time.

is there a default setting somehwere for screen orientation? for some reason when I load ubuntu, my screen is upside down until I go to settings and make it "normal" orientation instead of 180 degrees.... no idea why it's stuck on 180 every time. It just starting doing it 2 days ago after allowing ubuntu to download some updates.
you never changed the setting to 180?
are you the only user of that mach?
it just started happening after I allowed it to update
so you are upside down on the log screen?
so you are upside down on the log /in/screen?
no... login is fine.... and yes, after I log in, it's upside down... if I reset the orientation to normal, it goes normal, but if I log off and back in, it's upside down again...
you got a odd video driver or a driver with its own configuration app?
but does it have a setting app? and did you make changes to it?
I didn't manually change anything... I don't think it has a config app... but like I said, some kind of update might be related to this happening.
is there a config file that stores that default screen orientation i can look at?
on mine there is, nvidia has it, so does yours? it's a system app, something in the systems menu
there's no default config file that would include orientation?
